result.execSummary:
The defendant Christian M Ellifson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
With Huber.
Standard release.
Consecutive to: 16CF30

Defendant may petition the court for early release from probation after he served 2 years of probation.
Concurrent with: 16CF30

miscConds.notes: Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Domestic abuse counseling.
Attend 2 self help meetings per week.
No contact with Oconomowoc School Apts.
Any contact with the victim, at the discretion of the Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.

supervisions.notes:
Fine to be paid as a Condition of Probation on Count 2 and Case 16CF30.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
DNA costs to be paid as a Condition of Count 2 and Case 16CF30.

With Huber.
Court grants 46 days credit.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.

Amended Minutes 02/16/2016:

Defendant Christian M Ellifson in court, in custody, with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.  Jayne DeWire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea as to counts 2 and 4. Counts 1 and 3 are dismissed and read-in. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   Count 2

90 DAYS HUBER, w/Standard Release Conditions, consecutive

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Domestic Abuse Violence counseling
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  Oconcomowoc School Apts.,
*Any Contact with the victim at the discretion of the Agent
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done. 
*Attend at least 2 self help meetings per week. 
 .
COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 60 days  Huber



    The defendant was sentenced to the following: Count 4

HUBER:  61 days jail, (46 days credit)

FINE: $1179.00  (to be paid as a condition of his probation)

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00, (to be paid as a condition of his probation) 

DNA sample to be provided if not already provided

D/L REVOCATION: 14 months;

IGNITION INTERLOCK: 14 months;

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.

Expungement is denied. 
Defendant may petition the court for early release from probation after he has served 2 years of probation
